title: What are the limits of transmitting esoteric knowledge and why is initiation necessary for its understanding?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discusses the limitations of knowledge that comes from initiation, which requires a transformation of consciousness. This knowledge is not accessible to everyone and can't be degraded or profaned through transmission. In this last part, the author emphasizes that the nature of initiation knowledge requires differentiation and a strict hierarchy. It can't be reduced to theory or communicated to those who lack the same level of understanding. The author suggests that those who only recognize ordinary existence lack a common ground for true realization, and abandoning such thinking may be necessary for attaining truth and knowledge.
content: Ma se, come conseguenza, non ne deriva l’inizio di un moto dall’interno, anche ciò ha un valore nullo. Il carattere stesso della conoscenza iniziatica impone dunque la differenziazione. Per coloro, per i quali l’esistenza ordinaria e l’esperienza sensibile rappresentano il principio e la fine di tutto è naturale che manchi ogni terreno comune per quanto concerne quel conoscere che, per sua essenza, è realizzazione. Tutto ciò dovrebbe esser visto con perfetta chiarezza, insieme alla sua naturale conseguenza: abbandonare la partita ovvero ammettere, per la verità e la conoscenza, misure diverse da quelle venute a predominare nella cultura e nel pensiero moderno.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the path of initiation emphasizes the principle of "suum cuique" which acknowledges that each individual is entitled to their own knowledge, truth, and freedom. Though it may seem subjective to those accustomed to concrete experiences, initiation offers a profound understanding of oneself and the world. It is important to recognize these differences and abandon the modern-day notion of uniformity in knowledge and culture.
